alert.note: Alert for Southern Seward Peninsula Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 19 at 1:53PM AKDT until March 21 at 6:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 6 PM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with blizzard conditions at times. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting to 50 mph. Visibility less than one quarter mile at times. * WHERE...Southern Seward Peninsula Coast. * WHEN...From 4 AM Monday to 6 PM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could cause whiteout conditions. Large snow drifts will form. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blizzard conditions are expected to develop early Monday morning and continue into Tuesday. The strongest winds and worst conditions are expected Monday. Winds are expected to decrease Tuesday.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible.
